intro: Jaltomata estilopilosa, commonly known as the silverleaf jaltomata, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or blue in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
